messages.content: What is the purpose of the ComfyUI-load-image-from-url node?
The purpose of the ComfyUI-load-image-from-url node is to load an image from a local path or HTTP URL in ComfyUI.
In which category can you find the ComfyUI-load-image-from-url node?
You can find the ComfyUI-load-image-from-url node in the 'image' category.
What are the inputs for the ComfyUI-load-image-from-url node?
The inputs for the ComfyUI-load-image-from-url node include a 'url_or_path' parameter, which can be either a local file path or an HTTP URL pointing to an image.
What is the class type of the ComfyUI-load-image-from-url node?
The class type of the ComfyUI-load-image-from-url node is 'LoadImageFromUrlOrPath'.
What is the '_meta' title for the ComfyUI-load-image-from-url node?
The '_meta' title for the ComfyUI-load-image-from-url node is 'LoadImageFromUrlOrPath'.
What is the purpose of the 'Preview Image' node in the provided json example?
In the provided json example, the 'Preview Image' node is used to preview the image loaded by the ComfyUI-load-image-from-url node.
How is the loaded image passed from the ComfyUI-load-image-from-url node to the 'Preview Image' node?

The loaded image is passed from the ComfyUI-load-image-from-url node to the 'Preview Image' node using the 'images' input, which references the output of the ComfyUI-load-image-from-url node (node '1') and specifies the first (0-indexed) output.
